0.Pros: good I enjoyed the discount on food

2.Pros: Nice pay, a dollar above minimum wage. You can get some of the hours you want, and days off but you have to ask about a month in advance.
2.Cons: One of my managers came in high or late on multiple occasions, and many people were just downright rude to me while I worked there.

3.Pros: Flexibility in schedules is definitely a plus, full time student and part time worker they were definitely flexible in scheduling shifts around school, if you are firm with your schedule.
3.Cons: I mean working with the public, so getting cursed at, drinks & food thrown at you, the pressure to work under a deadline and act as if what happens in these four walls is the only thing that matters in your life. Yeah, but they're flexible.

4.Pros: McDonald's is a good place to work its fun easy and they have great benefits also they will work around your schedule if need so
4.Cons: Really don't have any con's except for Its a job and just like any job Some have issues with some they may work with But that's anywhere you go

5.Pros: busy shifts made the day go by faster
5.Cons: rude guests at times could affect your mood

6.Pros: I liked that this job was fast paced and there was rarely time to get bored.
6.Cons: The management was not the best.

7.Pros: You were able to use you employee discount during lunch.
7.Cons: Always was drama going on and workers never got along.it was always hot

8.Summary: "It was a great experience really enjoyed my time there and of course the food."
8.Pros: The best was the great communication that my workers had with each other and my manager was a great help with advisement and etc
8.Cons: The cons were that you have to be at that job 24/7. Working all day and everyday it really stresses you out and the customers are sometimes very rude so you have to keep your composure.

9.Cons: McDonald's has low pay to start out.
